page.title: 10FARMING OLD AND NEW
page.content: {Mrs Johnson}has lived here all her life.She lived at a farm called {Fairfield}very near the seashore.The farm was different years ago.There was only grassland and one ploughed field that they grew corn in.The farmer {threshed the corn}with a threshing machine and made stacks of straw for the{cows,sheep,and pigs}to eat in winter.The corn was bagged and sold to the corn merchant who sold it to a station.The cows were milked twice a day,morning and night by hand.The cream was churned into butter and shaped with scotch hands.They kill the pigs by hand and salted them for bacon.They{sheared the sheep by hand and sold the wool.A{horse}pulled a plough.Now a{tractor}is used.Now only cows ,milked by machine,are left.All the grassland is now ploughed for {wheat,barley,and}rape.
